title: What is this 50's looking font?
content:
What is this, or something similar? (The “Super 8 mm” part)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [szeged.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025044926/http:/typophile.com/files/szeged.gif) | 9.41 KB |

 [‹ (x) Yemenia plane lettering - Futura {Chester}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025044926/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15336 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Petals - hand scripted {Tiff} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025044926/http:/www.typophile.com/node/15291 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Tollundmanden

comments.content:
The Font Diner is a great place for retro 50’s typefaces.  
Try [Permanent Waves](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025044926/http:/www.fontdiner.com/menu_doggie.html).

————————————————————-  
Yes, I’m old, but I’m back in style!
i think it’s FontDiner, too. But i’m pretty sure this is one of Stuart’s freeware fonts. Try [Rocket Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025044926/http:/www.fontdiner.com/silver.html).

Thanks! Rocket Script works great.  
Just for curiosity’s sake, any idea what the “Festival” part is?
